description: Tests must NEVER contain guard clauses, defensive conditionals, or fallback paths. We control test setup - if it's wrong, the test MUST fail immediately. Guard clauses hide problems. Tests should assume positive outcomes. Example: Just call the code directly, don't wrap in if-checks

do.description: Assume correct setup - let test fail if wrong. Example: behavior = Behavior(name='shape') then assert behavior.name == 'shape'

guidance.description: Call code directly without checking preconditions
Assert the specific behavior path is taken
Let test fail if setup is wrong - this is valuable information
example: config = agent.load_config(config_file)  # Will fail if file missing - GOOD

dont.description: Don't add if-checks, type guards, or fallback handling in tests. Example: if behavior_file.exists(): (wrong - test should fail if it doesn't)

guidance.description: Don't check file existence before using file
example: behavior = Behavior(...)  # Test should fail if file missing!

guidance.description: Don't check variable types in tests
example: assert len(behavior_obj.actions) > 0  # Test should fail if wrong type!

guidance.description: Don't let fallback paths pass tests
example: assert result.stage == 'default_flow'  # WRONG - testing fallback not requirement

guidance.description: Don't add try/except around test code
example: except:  # Don't catch - let test fail!
